title: PING Issues (West)
body:
Since Sunday, my ping has doubled (around 45-46 to 85-92) for no reason. Ping is fine on other games.

SHAW, Alberta

replies.body: Are you still experiencing this issue?  I've seen a few threads about this this morning.  When you have some time, download the [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run a trace route to 104.160.131.1.  This will help give a better idea of what's happening.  Let me know!

https://gyazo.com/30865ae64efa690e33c376ffd35d6cd3

on the trace, I see that my route is directed to "chi01" shouldn't it be routed around the west? It could be the issue that it got changed

I'm not sure how your routing was previously, but this node would be Chicago which is a solid route per the[ road map](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204246204-NA-Server-Roadmap) for where you want to go.

Last week my ping has dramatically changed as well. Beofre: 40ms constant no fps lag, now: 60-80ms then spikes constantly 200-300 for a couple of seconds, sometimes 500, rarely over 500, then back down. Happens very frequently. Never ever hit 40ms anymore. I restarted modem/whatever none of the settings have changed except ip address because it's not static. Here is my picture for the WinMTR trace rout for 104.160.131.1 : http://imgur.com/MHVDQSG

I had a member of the tech team take a look at this for veracity, and some feedback I've received on this includes the Hitron router/modem.  This has been known to have some issues with league from functioning normally, and may need to be switched out.  Your ping is also increasing before every reaching our servers, so your routing is hitting a few bumps to get there. In addition,  I'd suggest reaching out to your ISP, and provide them with your traceroute.  They should be able to pinpoint their node to find out what's going on.  Hope that helps!

Would it be possible to ask ISPs to somehow re-route whatever server/bump I'm in? Not sure if it's the right question to ask but maybe you guys know.

And if I was to ask for a fix, will I still be providing the 104.160.131.1 IP?

Thanks a lot for the input!

You can request an investigation.  I suggest troubleshooting your connection issues first, as you are getting a bump as you're leaving your local network.  If you're unable to switch to another router, try our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to help, then run a few more traceroutes and let it run for a few minutes to be sure.
Thanks for the response! Will check asap
